dict.string: No. "Scarcely little" is redundant because "Scarcely" and "little" mean the same thing.

Sally's Fancy Hair Emporium To step into Sally's Fancy Hair Emporium is to step into the past. [1]ÊScarcely little has changed in this hair salon, the last of a dying breed.ÊSituated in the middle of what [2]Êonce used to beÊa busy shopping district, Sally's is now the lone storefront in a sea of abandoned buildings and transient hotels. On the walls are faded photographs of outdated hairstylesÐÐtowering beehives and bouffant flipsÐÐeach [3]Êmore outrageous than the last.ÊThree corners of the shop are dominated by shiny pink and chrome hair-styling stations.ÊThe fourth houses a much older station, its pale blue partitions cracked and dusty, dotted with memorabilia of its past occupantÐÐ"Betty," according to a dirty nameplate hanging from a single tack.ÊBetty's station has a ghostly aura. [4] A browning postcard with palm trees proclaims "Greetings from Cape May!" [5] The latest gossip flew around the lively atmosphere like so much hair spray.ÊOn a Friday the salons were extra crowded [6] aroundÊwomen beautifying themselves for the coming weekend festivitiesÐÐlittle Lena Jean's weddingÐÐor Faye Dobson's husband's funeral. With today's [7]Êwash and wear hairstyles, beauty salons have taken [8]Êover a completely different identity.ÊBusy executives are in and out, hair wet, on the way to the gym or their next appointment.ÊThe homey atmosphere of the local beauty parlor [9]Êhas gone theÊway of that of the neighborhood barbershopÐÐboth are utilitarian but somehow lacking in charm. [10] Just as in the rest of the world, the old customsÊare replacing the new in hair salons.ÊThe reality is that [11]Êthe convivial atmosphere will actually remember only a few old-timersÊof places like [12]ÊSally's, which theÊnext generation of young [13] women will have only the memoriesÊof their eld be forced to settle [14]ÊwithÊa lackluster approximation of this unique women's [15]Êexperience.ÊOr createÊa new version of the age-old tradition on their own. Use [1] Above
No. Be careful. This answer choice is redundant because "once" and "used to be" mean the same thing. You only need one of them.

Sally's Fancy Hair Emporium To step into Sally's Fancy Hair Emporium is to step into the past. [1]ÊScarcely little has changed in this hair salon, the last of a dying breed.ÊSituated in the middle of what [2]Êonce used to beÊa busy shopping district, Sally's is now the lone storefront in a sea of abandoned buildings and transient hotels. On the walls are faded photographs of outdated hairstylesÐÐtowering beehives and bouffant flipsÐÐeach [3]Êmore outrageous than the last.ÊThree corners of the shop are dominated by shiny pink and chrome hair-styling stations.ÊThe fourth houses a much older station, its pale blue partitions cracked and dusty, dotted with memorabilia of its past occupantÐÐ"Betty," according to a dirty nameplate hanging from a single tack.ÊBetty's station has a ghostly aura. [4] A browning postcard with palm trees proclaims "Greetings from Cape May!" [5] The latest gossip flew around the lively atmosphere like so much hair spray.ÊOn a Friday the salons were extra crowded [6] aroundÊwomen beautifying themselves for the coming weekend festivitiesÐÐlittle Lena Jean's weddingÐÐor Faye Dobson's husband's funeral. With today's [7]Êwash and wear hairstyles, beauty salons have taken [8]Êover a completely different identity.ÊBusy executives are in and out, hair wet, on the way to the gym or their next appointment.ÊThe homey atmosphere of the local beauty parlor [9]Êhas gone theÊway of that of the neighborhood barbershopÐÐboth are utilitarian but somehow lacking in charm. [10] Just as in the rest of the world, the old customsÊare replacing the new in hair salons.ÊThe reality is that [11]Êthe convivial atmosphere will actually remember only a few old-timersÊof places like [12]ÊSally's, which theÊnext generation of young [13] women will have only the memoriesÊof their elders from which to draw on as a vision of the past. The next generation will be forced to settle [14]ÊwithÊa lackluster approximation of this unique women's [15]Êexperience.ÊOr createÊa new version of the age-old tradition on their own. Use [2] Above
Good. You used the right construction for this comparison.

It was as old as the salon.
It is as though Betty may come back to life at any moment to resume her activities.
Betty kept her station very neat.

Use [4] Above Which of the following sentences, if added, would support the author's statement that Betty's station has a ghostly aura?
It is difficult to understand why people love to gossip so much.
Men get their hair cut by barbers, while women get their hair "done" by hairdressers.
In the past, the local hair salon was a focal point in a woman's world.
Hairspray has always been one of the hairdresser's best-loved tools.
